Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the bottom of the fifth inning against Tarik Skubal.
Trey Sweeney scored on a bunt single in the bottom of the fourth inning, bringing Kerry Carpenter to the plate with the bases loaded.
Jose Ramirez was hit by a pitch, allowing Lane Thomas to score with a grand slam in the bottom of the fifth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Detroit Tigers hit three balls off the wall in the game, but only Lane Thomas cleared the wall with a grand slam.
The Tigers struggled with Cleveland Guardians' starter Matt Boyd in the first inning.
Detroit Tigers' ace Tarik Skubal faced a challenge against Cleveland Guardians' lineup, especially with Lane Thomas hitting a grand slam.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit Tigers will head home after a very successful season and the most shocking and exciting stretch drive in team history.
Cleveland Guardians advance to the American League Championship Series against the New York Yankees.
Detroit Tigers' manager, AJ Hinch, expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Detroit Tigers will focus on improving their lineup, finding more power, and bolstering the rotation for the 2025 season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured tense at-bats and key moments, including a grand slam by Lane Thomas and a bunt single by Trey Sweeney.
Detroit Tigers' right-handed hitters struggled against Cleveland Guardians' pitchers, particularly with Lane Thomas clearing the wall with a grand slam.
